Other Notes |- | 2005 | ''[[Fight Night Round 2]]'' | rowspan="7"|Himself | rowspan="4"|Playable fighter |- | 2006 | ''[[Fight Night Round 3]]'' |- | 2009 | ''[[Fight Night Round 4]]'' |- | rowspan="2"|2011 | ''[[Fight Night Champion]]'' |- | ''Pound for Pound'' | Main character - Mobile game |- | 2015 | ''PBA Philippine Slam!'' | Playable player - Mobile game |- | 2017 | ''Real Boxing: Manny Pacquiao'' | Main character - Mobile game |} ==Controversy== ===Tax evasion case=== On November 26, 2013, a few days after Pacquiao's victory over [[Brandon Rios]], the Philippine [[Bureau of Internal Revenue (Philippines)|Bureau of Internal Revenue]] (BIR) issued a freeze order on all of Pacquiao's Philippine bank accounts due to his alleged failure to pay [[Philippine peso|₱]]2.2 billion in taxes for earnings he made in his fights in the United States from 2008 to 2009. A day after the bank account freeze, the BIR also issued an order to freeze all of Pacquiao's Philippine properties, whereupon Pacquiao presented documents to the press showing the income tax for non-resident alien payment by his [[Top Rank|promoter]] to the BIR's US counterpart, the [[Internal Revenue Service]], as well as a letter from [[Bob Arum]].{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/337272/economy/moneyandbanking/pacquiao-shows-us-tax-document-but-bir-says-it-has-no-proof-of-payment|title=Pacquiao shows US tax document but BIR says it has no proof of payment|work=gmanetwork.com}} In April 2017, Pacquiao, now a senator, approached Philippine authorities in an attempt to settle the case. The BIR had maintained that taxes were due even if all taxes had been paid to the IRS in the first place.{{cite web|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/business/04/18/17/pacquiao-says-he-wants-to-end-p22-b-tax-case|title=Pacquaio says he wants to end P2.2-B tax case}} ===Comments on homosexuality and same-sex marriage=== In May 2012, Pacquiao was mistakenly quoted as saying "gay men should be put to death."{{cite web|url=http://bossip.com/586277/hi-hater-manny-pacquiao-believes-that-gays-should-be-put-to-death-43081/|title=Manny Pacquiao says that gay people should be put to death – Bossip|work=Bossip}} Pacquiao did not say those words.{{cite web|url=http://www.laweekly.com/news/update-manny-pacquiao-did-not-say-gay-men-should-be-put-to-death-2388143|title=Update: Manny Pacquiao Did Not Say Gay Men Should Be Put to Death*|author=Dennis Romero|work=L.A. Weekly}} Granville Ampong, the writer who wrote the article containing the Bible verse, said that it was he and not Pacquiao who quoted the verse in his article.{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/258431/sports/boxing/pacquiao-misquoted-on-anti-gay-comments-says-examiner-com-writer|title=Pacquiao misquoted on anti-gay comments, says Examiner.com writer|work=GMA News Online|accessdate=May 2, 2016}} Pacquiao is against [[same-sex marriage]] and quoted as saying "God only expects man and women to be together and to be legally married."{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/05/16/manny-pacquiao-gay-marriage-leviticus-examiner_n_1521747.html|title=Manny Pacquiao Against Same-Sex Marriage But Never Said Gay People 'Must Be Put To Death'|work=The Huffington Post | date=May 16, 2012}} {{cquote|If we approve male on male, female on female (marriage), then man is worse than animal.|author=Part of Manny Pacquiao's stand on same-sex marriage in a video statement by TV5 posted on February 15, 2016.{{cite news|url=http://www.interaksyon.com/interaktv/manny-pacquiaos-stand-on-same-sex-marriage-mas-masahol-pa-sa-hayop-ang-tao|title=Manny Pacquiao's stand on same-sex marriage: 'Mas masahol pa sa hayop ang tao'|publisher=''[[InterAksyon]]''|date=February 15, 2016|accessdate=February 17, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160216224554/http://www.interaksyon.com/interaktv/manny-pacquiaos-stand-on-same-sex-marriage-mas-masahol-pa-sa-hayop-ang-tao|archivedate=February 16, 2016|df=mdy-all}}}} In February 2016, Pacquiao, in a video statement posted by [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]], made a comment on the issue of same-sex marriage. Pacquiao, in vernacular, described people in same-sex marriages as behaving worse than animals because animals generally do not have same-sex mating.{{cite news|url=http://sports.abs-cbn.com/boxing/news/2016/02/16/pacquiao-draws-flak-masahol-pa-sa-hayop-comment-8860|title=Pacquiao draws flak for "masahol pa sa hayop" comment|publisher=''[[ABS-CBN Sports]]''|date=February 16, 2016|accessdate=February 16, 2016}} LGBT celebrities including comedian [[Vice Ganda]], singer [[Aiza Seguerra]], TV host [[Boy Abunda]] and the party-list [[Ladlad]] criticized the statements of the senatorial candidate. Pacquiao later apologized and stated that while, as a Christian, he is still against same-sex marriage, which is against Biblical teachings, and he did not condemn gay people themselves,{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-35585016|title=Philippine boxer Manny Pacquiao apologises for gay slur|work=[[BBC]]|date=February 16, 2016|accessdate=February 16, 2016}} saying that he loves them all and is praying for them.{{cite web|url=http://www.lifesitenews.com/news/boxing-champ-manny-pacquiao-defends-natural-marriage-gets-pummelled-by-west|title=Boxing champ Manny Pacquiao defends natural marriage, gets pummelled by Western press|work=LifeSiteNews|accessdate=May 2, 2016}} [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]] ended their longtime partnership with Pacquiao stating his comments against gay people were abhorrent.{{cite web|last1=Fernandez|first1=Erick|title=Nike Drops Manny Pacquiao Following Anti-Gay Comments|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/nike-manny-pacquiao-anti-gay-comments_us_56c49e12e4b0b40245c8918c|publisher=Huffington Post|accessdate=February 18, 2016}} [[The Grove at Farmers Market]] in [[Los Angeles]] also [[Persona non grata|banned]] Pacquiao from the shopping mall.{{cite news|url=http://www.rappler.com/sports/by-sport/boxing-mma/pacquiao/126323-pacquiao-banned-grove|title=Manny Pacquiao once again banned from The Grove over gay remarks|publisher=''[[Rappler]]''|date=March 18, 2016|accessdate=March 19, 2016}} Towards the end of the video, Pacquiao clarified that he is not condemning gay people. {{cquote|...but I am not condemning them, just the marriage which is a sin against God.|author=Continuation of Manny Pacquiao's stand on same-sex marriage in a video statement by TV5 posted later on February 19, 2016.{{cite news|url=http://www.thesummitexpress.com/2016/02/Manny-Pacquiao-uncut-version-interview-video.html|title=VIDEO: Uncut version of Manny Pacquiao's controversial interview emerges online|publisher=''The Summit Express''|date=February 19, 2016|accessdate=February 19, 2016}}}} ===Disclosure of injury=== It was revealed following [[Floyd Mayweather Jr. vs. Manny Pacquiao|Mayweather vs. Pacquiao]] that Pacquiao had sustained an undisclosed injury to his right shoulder while training, and that while it had healed in time for the fight, he re-injured it during the 4th round. {{as of|2015}}, Pacquiao is currently facing a lawsuit of 5 million dollars filed against him by two fans for failing to disclose the shoulder injury in the lead up to his bout with [[Floyd Mayweather Jr.|Floyd Mayweather]].{{cite Pacquiao said he had sustained the injury weeks out from the fight against Mayweather. However, after the lawsuit from the two fans was filed against him, Pacquiao has since said that he sustained the injury during the fight in which it flared up in the 3rd round.{{cite web|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/sport/boxing/article4431663.ece|title=Nevada State stance rubs salt into Pacquiao's wound|work=The Times}} The Nevada State Athletic Commission stated at the post fight press conference that they had only just found out about Pacquiao's injury that evening at the post fight press conference. Speculation arose that the injury was an excuse for the loss to Mayweather because Pacquiao did not mention an injury in the post fight interview with [[Max Kellerman]]. {{Use Indian English|date=February 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2013}} {{good article}} The '''Manoj–Babli honour killing case''' was the [[honour killing]] of [[India]]n newlyweds Manoj Banwala and Babli in June 2007 and the subsequent court case which historically convicted defendants for an honour killing. The accused in the murder included relatives of Babli (grandfather Gangaraj, who is said to have been a Khap leader,<ref>[http://dainiktribuneonline.com/2010/03/%E0%A4%A4%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B2%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%AC%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%A8%E0%A5%80-%E0%A4%AB%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%AE%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%A8-%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%8B-%E0%A4%AB%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%A6%E0%A4%BE/ मनोज-बबली हत्याकांड में पांच को मौत की सजा, दो को उम्रकैद, March - 31 - 2010]</ref> brother, maternal and paternal uncles and two cousins). Relatives of Manoj, especially his mother, defended the relationship.<ref>[http://janjwar.blogspot.com/2010/04/blog-post_14.html घरवाली नहीं, घरवालियों की जीत, Apr 14, 2010]</ref> The killing was ordered by a ''[[khap]] [[panchayat]]'' (''khap''), a religious [[Caste system in India|caste]]-based council among [[Jat people|Jats]], in their Karora village in [[Kaithal district]], [[Haryana]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://daily.bhaskar.com/news/CHD-manoj-babli-honour-killing-in-haryana-4819122-NOR.html|title=Manoj-Babli honor killing case: This mother challenged dreaded khap; here are chilling details|work=Dainik Bhaskar|date=25 November 2014|accessdate=21 March 2018}}</ref> The ''khap'' passed a [[decree]] prohibiting marriage against [[Norm (sociology)|societal norms]]. Such caste-based councils are common in the inner regions of several Indian states, including Haryana, [[Punjab]], western [[Uttar Pradesh]] and parts of [[Rajasthan]], and have been operating with government approval for years.<ref name=ht/> In any event, the state government expressed no concern about the ruling of the ''khap panchayat''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-04/india/28143211_1_village-in-kaithal-district-khap-jat-community|title='Marriage, murder, judgment, it was all wrong'|last=Sengupta|first=Nandita|date=4 April 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=[[The Times Group]]|accessdate=8 April 2010}}</ref>
The Khap panchayat's ruling was based on the assumption that Manoj and Babli belonged to the Banwala [[gotra]], a [[Jat]] community, and were therefore considered to be siblings despite not being directly related and any union between them would be invalid and [[incestuous]]. Nevertheless, the couple went ahead with their marriage, following which they were abducted and killed by Babli's relatives.<ref name=ht>{{cite journal|date=14–27 July 2007 |title=All for 'honour' |journal=[[Frontline (magazine)|Frontline]] |volume=24 |issue=14 |url=http://www.hinduonnet.com/fline/fl2414/stories/20070727003103500.htm |accessdate=8 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100412144515/http://www.hinduonnet.com/fline/fl2414/stories/20070727003103500.htm |archivedate=12 April 2010 |df= }}</ref><ref name=the_australian>{{cite news|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/india-at-odds-as-caste-culture-turns-to-killing/story-e6frg6so-1225849033844|title=India at odds as caste culture turns to killing |date=3 April 2010|first=Amanda|last=Hodge|publisher=[[The Australian]] |accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref>
In March 2010, a [[Karnal]] district court sentenced the five perpetrators to be executed, the first time an Indian court had done so in an honour killing case. The khap head who ordered but did not take part in the killings received a [[Life imprisonment|life sentence]], and the driver involved in the abduction a seven-year prison term. According to [[Minister for Home Affairs (India)|Home Minister]] [[P. Chidambaram]], the [[United Progressive Alliance|UPA]]-led [[Government of India|central government]] was to propose an amendment to the [[Indian Penal Code]] (IPC) in response to the deaths of Manoj and Babli, making honour killings a "distinct offense".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100328/main4.htm|title=Who gave khaps the right to kill: PC|first=Vibha|last=Sharma|work=[[Tribune Company]]|publisher=[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]|date=28 March 2010|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref><ref name=te/><ref name=TOI>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-07-10/india/28276511_1_honour-killings-vani-gopal-sharma-ganga-raj|title=Should honour killing be dealt as murder?|publisher=[[The Times of India]]|date=10 July 2010|accessdate=8 September 2010}}</ref>
==Background== Manoj's and Babli's families lived in Karoran Village, [[Kaithal]]. Manoj's mother, Chanderpati Berwal, had four children, of whom Manoj was the eldest.<ref name=ht/><ref name=joshi>{{cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Haryana-village-boycotts-honour-killing-victim-s-family-again/Article1-523841.aspx|title=Haryana village boycotts honour killing victim's family, again|last=Joshi|first=Vishal|date=27 March 2010|publisher=Hindustan Times|accessdate=27 May 2010}}</ref> Chanderpati was widowed at the age of 37, when Manoj was only 9.<ref name=ht/> Manoj owned an electronics repair shop at Kaithal<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/Haryana+court+convicts+7+for+honour+killing.-a0222289585|title=Haryana court convicts 7 for honour killing|date=26 March 2010|work=The Free Library|publisher=[[Mail Today]]|accessdate=9 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/6-convicted-in-Haryana-honour-killing-case/articleshow/5724543.cms |title=6 convicted in Haryana honour killing case |date=25 March 2010 |work=[[Indo-Asian News Service|IANS]] |publisher=[[The Times of India]] |accessdate=28 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100328233556/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/6-convicted-in-Haryana-honour-killing-case/articleshow/5724543.cms |archivedate=28 March 2010 }}</ref> and was the only member of his family earning a livelihood.<ref name=ht/><ref name=te/> Manoj's cousin, Narender, lived with the family and worked in [[Panchkula]].<ref name=indiatoday/>
Babli's mother, Ompati, also had four children, including eldest son, Suresh<ref name=indiatoday/>. Like Manoj, Suresh was the only bread winner of the family.<ref name=Siwach>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-01/india/28123564_1_honour-killings-chandrapati-woman-judge|title=Judge calls for new law to deal with honour killings|first=Sukhbir|last=Siwach|author2=Manoj Dhaka|date=1 April 2010|work=The Times Group|publisher=[[The Times of India]]|accessdate=27 May 2010}}</ref> Babli was still studying in school.<ref name=Lohumi/> Ompati is a widow.{{#tag:ref|Conflicting reports exist as to when Ompati's husband died. According to the judge of the case, Vani Gopal Sharma, her husband died two years before the murder.<ref name=Siwach/> According to a quote from Ompati, her husband died of trauma after the murder.<ref name=dailypioneer/> ''[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]'' reported that Ompati's husband had died when her "children were very young".<ref name=Gayatri2/>|group=note}}
==Development of the relationship and subsequent marriage== [[File:Manoj Banwala (23) and Babli (19), after their marriage, April 2007.jpg|right|thumb|210px|alt=Newlyweds garlanded with marigolds|Manoj and Babli after their marriage in Chandigarh in April 2007]] In 2005, Manoj and Babli began to show interest in each other.<ref name=Lohumi>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100326/haryana.htm#1|title=6 of girl's kin held guilty |first=Bhanu P.|last=Lohumi|work=[[Tribune Company]]|publisher=[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]|date=25 March 2010|accessdate=3 May 2010|location=Karnal}}</ref> Manoj was four years older than Babli. All residents of Karora village belong to the same clan, Banwala, a Jat community, and marrying within the clan is considered [[incest]].<ref name=te>{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1100331/jsp/nation/story_12285441.jsp|first=Gajinder|last=Singh|title=Death for honour killings|date=31 March 2010|publisher=[[The Telegraph (Kolkata)|The Telegraph]] |accessdate=4 April 2010|location=Calcutta, India}}</ref><ref name=NDTV>{{cite news|url=http://www.ndtv.com/news/cities/karnal-honour-killing-sentencing-today-18699.php|title=Karnal honour killing: Death sentence for 5, life for 1 |date=30 March 2010|publisher=[[NDTV|NDTV Convergence Limited]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/six-to-be-sentenced-today-for-honour-killing/596849/|title=Six to be sentenced today for 'honour killing'|first=Mandakini|last= Gahlot|date=29 March 2010|publisher=[[The Indian Express]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> Chanderpati recalled, "We knew about Babli long before they decided to marry each other. She would call up often and I would sermonise to her about staying away from Manoj, fearing the fallout of such an alliance. They were, however, unconcerned and chatted for hours together. If I did walk into the room while they were talking, Manoj would quickly disconnect the phone and run off to avoid any questioning." She continued, "I even went to Babli's house and told her mother that Manoj and Babli were seeing each other. I asked her to dissuade Babli or quickly marry her off before word of their dalliance spread."<ref name=Gayatri>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100331/khapdiktat.htm#3|title=A love story with a full stop|first=Geetanjali|last=Gayatri|date=30 March 2010|work=Tribune Company|publisher=The Tribune|accessdate=4 April 2010|location=Kaithal}}</ref>
Two years later, on 5 April 2007, Chanderpati last saw Manoj. "He ate his food and left to sleep at the shop since he had a class XII compartment exam in English to take the next day. Unlike other days, next morning, he did not show up." The following day Babli's uncle arrived to speak with Manoj. According to Chanderpati, "He said he had come to recover some money that Manoj had borrowed, had tea and left when I told him that Manoj was away for an exam. We only discovered late in the evening that Babli, too, was missing and the two had run away." Manoj had eloped with Babli to [[Chandigarh]] and married her on 7 April at a [[Durga]] temple, their commitment to one another transcending their willingness to abide by societal norms.<ref name=Gayatri/>
Furious with the marriage, Babli's family asked for intervention from the local ''khap panchayat'',<ref name=NDTV/> which annulled the marriage.<ref name=TOI/> The ''khap'' also announced a social boycott on Manoj's family. Anyone who kept ties with them would be fined [[Indian rupees|Rs.]] 25,000.<ref name=joshi/><ref name=indiatoday/> Ompati tried to persuade her family that Babli did nothing dishonourable and that she and Manoj would move back home soon.<ref name=ht/>
==Court appearance== {{Quote box|align=right|width=27em|border=1px|bgcolor=#c6dbf7|quoted=true|quote=The court gave them protection but Manoj called us one day to say that Babli's relatives had been chasing them and that the policemen entrusted with protecting them had left them alone, so they were leaving for Delhi. He said his cellphone had run out of balance and that we should call him. But when we called him after about an hour, his phone was switched off and there was no communication with them after that.|salign=right|source=—Chanderpati<ref name=indiatoday/>}} On 26 April, Babli's family filed a [[First Information Report]] (FIR) against Manoj and his family for kidnapping Babli.<ref name=Gupta/> On 15 June, Manoj went to court with Babli, testifying that they had married in conformity with the law and that he did not kidnap Babli. The judge ordered police protection for the two.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2007-07-03/india/27974438_1_haryana-village-bus-driver-babli|title=Villagers defend 'honour killing'|first=Ramaninder K. |last=Bhatia|date=3 July 2007|work=The Times Group|publisher=[[The Times of India]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref><ref name=diktat>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-03-31/india/28114517_1_manoj-and-babli-khap-ganga-raj|title=Five to hang for khap death diktat|last=Siwach|first=Sukhbir|date=31 March 2010|work=The Times Group|publisher=[[The Times of India]]|accessdate=9 April 2010}}</ref> Chandrapati did not attend the trial so that Babli's family would not be aware that Manoj and Babli were in town.<ref name=Gayatri/>
After the trial, Manoj and Babli, accompanied by a team of five police officers assigned to them for protection, left for Chandigarh. The police left them at Pipli and slipped away.<ref name=Gupta>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2007/20070703/haryana.htm#1|title=Honour killing rocks state, again|last=Gupta|first=Yoginder|author2=Satish Seth|date=2 July 2007|publisher=[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]|accessdate=9 April 2010|location=Chandigarh}}</ref><ref name=deccan>{{cite news|url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/op-ed/feudal-justice-feudal-crime-034|title=Feudal justice for a feudal crime|last=Sen |first=Antara Dev|date=3 April 2010|publisher=[[The Deccan Chronicle]]|accessdate=10 April 2010}} {{Dead link|date=April 2012|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> Suspecting foul play, Manoj and Babli did not continue toward Chandigarh, instead boarding a bus for [[Karnal]].<ref name=deccan/> According to a statement filed by Chanderpati, later that day, around 3:40 pm, she received a call from a Pipli telephone booth from Manoj, who said that the police had deserted them, and Babli's family members were trailing them, so they would try to take a bus to [[Delhi]] and call her back later. Babli asked for acceptance from Chanderpati, who replied affirmatively.<ref name=Gayatri2>{{cite web|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100329/main6.htm|title=Now, slain boy's mother faces life threat|last=Gayatri|first=Geetanjali|date=28 March 2010 |work=Tribune Company|publisher=[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]|accessdate=7 September 2010}}</ref> That was the last time Manoj's family heard from the couple.<ref name=ht/><ref name=indiatoday>{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/site/Story/90863/Honourable+justice.html?complete=1|title=Honourable justice|date=1 April 2010|first=Arvind|last=Chhabra |publisher=Indian Times|accessdate=29 April 2010}}</ref><ref name=hindustan>{{cite web|url=http://epaper.hindustantimes.com/CWArticle.aspx |title=Death verdict for 5 in Karnal honour killing |date=13 April 2010 |publisher=[[Hindustan Times]] |accessdate=29 April 2010 }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref>
On 20 June, Chanderpati's complaint regarding the kidnapping was filed as an FIR at the Bhutana police station following media pressure on the police.<ref name=Lohumi/>
==Kidnapping and murder== The couple's bus left for Delhi, but ''en route'' at 4:30 pm, Babli's relatives stopped the bus near Raipur Jatan village, about {{convert|20|km|mi|}} from Pipli. They kidnapped the couple in a [[Mahindra Scorpio|Scorpio]] [[SUV]] driven by Mandeep Singh.<ref name=outlook>{{cite web|url=http://news.outlookindia.com/item.aspx?678281|title=5 Get Death Sentence in Haryana Honour Killing Case Karnal |date=30 March 2010 |publisher=[[Outlook (magazine)|Outlook]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> Kuldip Thekedar,<ref name=tribuneindia2/> a road contractor, witnessed the kidnapping and filed a complaint at the Butana police station in Karnal district, giving the [[Vehicle registration plate|licence plate]] number of the Scorpio.<ref name=ht/><ref name=tribuneindia3>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100331/khapdiktat.htm#1|title=Police drove them to death|first=Bhanu P.|last=Lohumi|date=30 March 2010|work=Tribune Company|publisher=The Tribune|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> Later, Chanderpati ascribed the murder to the unauthorised withdrawal of the couple's security team ignoring the orders given by the district and sessions judge (DSJ) of Kaithal.<ref name=cs>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2007-08-11/chandigarh/27977589_1_babli-head-constable-police-officers|title=Honour killing: Notice to Haryana CS|work=The Times Group|publisher=[[The Times of India]]|date=11 August 2007|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> Upon receiving no further news, Chanderpati's nephew, Narendra Singh traced the contractor, and after he was shown a photo of the couple, the contractor recognised the couple. The family then understood that Manoj and Babli were the victims of the kidnapping.<ref name=ht/>
After the kidnapping, the couple were beaten. Babli's brother Suresh forced her to consume pesticide, while four other family members pushed Manoj to the ground, her uncle Rajinder pulling a [[noose]] around Manoj's neck and strangling him in front of Babli.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-02/chandigarh/28115027_1_ganga-raj-rajender-and-baru-ram-vani-gopal-sharma|title=Brutality of honour killing shocks court|first=Sukhbir|last=Siwach|date=2 April 2010|work=The Times Group|publisher=[[The Times of India]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> They wrapped the bodies in [[gunny sack]]s<ref name=indiatoday/> and dumped them in Barwala Link Canal in [[Hisar district]]. On 23 June, nine days later, their mutilated bodies, hands and feet tied, were fished out of the canal by Kheri Chowki police.<ref name=Lohumi/> After [[autopsy]],<ref name=dc/> police preserved Manoj's shirt and Babli's anklet<ref name=tribuneindia3/> and cremated the bodies as unclaimed on 24 June.<ref name=deccan/><ref name=hindustan/> On 1 July the family identified them by the remnants of their clothing.<ref name=indiatoday/> The accused were subsequently arrested.
Police discovered a number of articles in the Scorpio used to kidnap the couple—parts of Babli's anklet, two buttons from Manoj's shirt, and torn photographs of the couple. Manoj's purse was found on one of the accused.<ref name="Lohumi2"/><ref name=Siwach2>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-03-26/india/28119933_1_babli-khap-manoj|title=Khap leader convicted for 'honour killing'|last=Siwach|first=Sukhbir|date=26 March 2010 |publisher=[[The Times of India]]|accessdate=8 September 2010}}</ref>
==Court judgement== As no Karnal lawyer would take up the case, Manoj's family had to find lawyers from [[Hisar, Haryana|Hisar]].<ref name=tribuneindia4>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100331/khapdiktat.htm#4|title=They are both alive, claims the defence|first=Geetanjali|last=Gayatri|author2=Bhanu P. Lohumi|date=31 March 2010|work=Tribune Company|publisher=The Tribune|accessdate=7 June 2010}}</ref><ref name=dailypioneer2>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailypioneer.com/245539/Manoj-Bubbly-murder-case-sentence-today.html |title=Manoj-Bubbly murder case sentence today |date=30 March 2010 |first=Nitish |last=Sharma |work=The Pioneer |publisher=CMYK Printech Ltd. |accessdate=28 May 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110616065959/http://www.dailypioneer.com/245539/Manoj-Bubbly-murder-case-sentence-today.html |archivedate=16 June 2011 }}</ref> Later on Adv. Sunil Rana from Karnal accepted the case, arguing on their behalf [[Prosecutor|public prosecutor]] Sunil Rana<ref name=outlook/><ref name=tribuneindia2/> and lawyers Lal Bahadur,<ref name=outlook/> Surat Singh, Cornel Omparkash, and Rakesh Manjhu from [[Hisar, Haryana]].<ref name=dailypioneer2/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailypioneer.com/245900/Five-get-death-for-honour-killings.html |title=Court cracks down on medieval system of justice |date=31 March 2010 |first=Nitish |last=Sharma |work=The Pioneer |publisher=CMYK Printech Ltd. |accessdate=2 June 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110616070104/http://www.dailypioneer.com/245900/Five-get-death-for-honour-killings.html |archivedate=16 June 2011 }}</ref> Bahadur argued that the couples' clothes recovered from the canal and photographs from the Scorpio established that day's happenings. Bahadur also cited the contractor's statement and the last phone call from Manoj, in which Manoj had related that Babli's relatives were trailing them.<ref name=tribuneindia4/> However, the contractor "turned hostile" and withdrew his statement.<ref name="Lohumi2">{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100329/main6.htm#2|title=Haryana khap killings: Sentence today|first=Lohumi|last=Bhanu P.|date=28 March 2010|work=Tribune Company|publisher=The Tribune|accessdate=7 September 2010}}</ref>
Arguing for the defence was lawyer Jagmal Singh.<ref name=dailypioneer2/> He asserted that there was no evidence against the accused and that it was all contrived by the media, no evidence that the ''khap panchayat'' ever met to discuss the fate of the couple, and no evidence indicating that Manoj and Babli were dead. The cremated bodies recovered from the canal were never confirmed to be those of Manoj and Babli.<ref name=tribuneindia4/>
On 29 March 2010, after 33 months of 50 hearings{{#tag:ref|Reports differed as to the number of hearings. Some said 50,<ref name=outlook/><ref name=dc/> while others said 76.<ref name=indiatoday/>|group=note}} with 41 witnesses, the Karnal District court found the accused guilty of murder, kidnapping, conspiracy, and destroying evidence under respective sections in the IPC.{{#tag:ref|Sections 302, 364, 120B, and 21.<ref name=dc>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-03-29/india/28113376_1_khap-panchayat-ganga-raj-baru-ram|title=Court defers sentencing in Karnal honour killing till Tuesday|date= 29 March 2010 |publisher=Press Trust of India (PTI)|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref><ref name=tribuneindia/>|group=note}} The next day, 30 March, for the first time in Haryana state history, a death penalty verdict was announced in the [[double murder]] case for the five accused. All were related to Babli, and included her brother Suresh, cousins Gurdev and Satish, paternal uncle Rajender, and maternal uncle Baru Ram.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-05/chandigarh/28122512_1_baru-ram-manoj-and-babli-honour|first=Vijay|last=Sabharwal|title=Men kill to protect honour, kin bear brunt|date=5 April 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=The Times Group|accessdate=28 April 2010}}</ref> The leader of the ''khap panchayat'' Ganga Raj (52),<ref name=indiatoday/> was given a life sentence for conspiracy,<ref name=cn/><ref name=abc>{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2010/03/31/2860828.htm|first=Sally|last=Sara|title=Five to be executed for honour killings|date=31 March 2010|publisher=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News Australia]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref><ref name=BBC>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8595168.stm|title=Death penalty in India 'honour killings' case |date=30 March 2010 |publisher=[[BBC News Online]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> while the driver, Mandeep Singh, held guilty of kidnapping, was given a jail term of seven years.<ref name=BBC/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/haryana/Death-sentence-for-five-in-Haryana-honour-killing-case/Article1-525002.aspx|title=Five 'honour killers' get death|date=30 March 2010|work=[[Hindustan Times]]|publisher=HT Media Limited|accessdate=9 April 2010|location=Karnal}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.zeenews.com/news614876.html|title=Karnal court to deliver verdict against Khap Panchayat killers|work=ZeeNews.com|publisher=[[Press Trust of India]]|accessdate=28 April 2010|location=Haryana}}</ref> The court asked the Haryana government to provide a compensation of Rs. 100,000 to Chanderpati, who had filed the case.<ref name=diktat/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.rediff.com/report/2010/mar/30/five-get-death-in-karnal-honour-killing-case.htm|title=5 get death in Karnal honour killing case|date=30 March 2010|work=[[Rediff.com]]|publisher=Rediff News Bureau|accessdate=28 April 2010}}</ref> Ganga Raj was fined Rs. 16,000, and the other six convicts Rs. 6,000 each.<ref name=tribuneindia/>
The court also accused six police personnel of dereliction of duty and directed the [[Superintendent of Police (India)|SSP]] of Kaithal to take action against them.<ref name=thehindu/> The personnel included head constable Jayender Singh, sub-inspector Jagbir Singh, and the members of the escort party provided to the couple.<ref name=dailypioneer>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailypioneer.com/245899/Verdict-a-deterrent-for-%E2%80%98Taliban-style-courts%E2%80%99.html |title=Victim's kin unhappy with sentence |date=31 March 2010 |work=[[The Pioneer (Indian newspaper)|The Pioneer]] |publisher=CMYK Printech Ltd. |accessdate=29 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110616065909/http://www.dailypioneer.com/245899/Verdict-a-deterrent-for-%E2%80%98Taliban-style-courts%E2%80%99.html |archivedate=16 June 2011 }}</ref><ref name=tribuneindia>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100331/main1.htm|title=5 get death for 'honour killing': First capital punishment for such crime in Haryana|date=31 March 2010|first=Bhanu P.|last=Lohumi|publisher=[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> They claimed that the couple wanted them to leave.<ref name=tribuneindia3/> The SSP's statement was that "[i]t is correct that the deceased couple had given in writing not to take police security any further, but Jagbir Singh was well aware that there was a threat to their lives from the relatives of the girl." The report stated that Jayender informed Gurdev Singh of the location of the police and that of Manoj and Babli over his mobile phone.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-07-25/india/28174070_1_honour-killings-kaithal-court-manoj-and-babli|last=Siwach|first=Sukhbir|title=Honour over love: Over 100 killed every yr|date=25 July 2007|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=The Times Group|accessdate=28 April 2010}}</ref> Jayender was dismissed from the police force, and both he and Jagbir were penalised by a cut of two increments.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2008/20080608/haryana.htm#5|title=Cops held guilty of failing in duty|date=7 June 2008|first=Swati|last=Sharma|publisher=[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]|accessdate=4 April 2010|location=Chandigarh}}</ref>
In her verdict, district judge Vani Gopal Sharma stated, "This court has gone through sleepless nights and tried to put itself in the shoes of the offenders and think as to what might have prompted them to take such a step."<ref name=tribuneindia2>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100401/haryana.htm#6|title=Court castigates police role|date=31 March 2010|work=[[Tribune Company]]|publisher=[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]|accessdate=30 April 2010|location=Karnal}}</ref> "Khap panchayats have functioned contrary to the constitution, ridiculed it and have become a law unto themselves."<ref name=the_australian/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/india/7540025/India-sentences-five-men-to-death-for-honour-killings.html|title=India sentences five men to death for 'honour killings'|date=31 March 2010|publisher=[[The Daily Telegraph#Website|The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=28 April 2010|location=London}}</ref>
Bahadur<ref name=outlook/> was satisfied with the decision, "Out of seven accused, five have been given death sentences. This will send a strong message to the public that law is greater than the khap."<ref name=thehindu>{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/article329247.ece|title=Death penalty for 5 involved in honour killing in Haryana|date=30 March 2010|publisher=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=28 April 2010|location=Chennai, India}}</ref> However, he was disappointed that "the leader [Ganga Raj] got away with death penalty because he intentionally disappeared during the killing."<ref name=cn/> Narendra said, "We will appeal in High Court for death penalty to the main accused, Ganga Raj. We respect the court's decision but he should be punished so that the instigators of the crime get the punishment. Also it is important that it is a very clear message so that no khap gives such directions, ever."<ref name=thehindu/> Seema seconded Narendra's concerns, "We would have been happier if the main accused was also given the death sentence. The decision of the panchayat was not justified and people should not to be allowed to misuse their power. We have fought this battle alone when no one was supporting us." She requested more security for her family, "They tried to bribe us to withdraw the case then they threatened that they would kill us if we didn't withdraw the FIR. Even after the decision we're afraid of a backlash from the Khap Panchayat."<ref name=thehindu/>
==Aftermath==
===Historical significance=== The case was the first resulting in the conviction of ''khap panchayats''<ref name=diktat/><ref name=cn>{{cite news|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/5-get-death-penalty-in-honour-killing-case/112360-3.html|title=5 get death penalty in honour killing case|date=31 March 2010|publisher=[[CNN-IBN]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1100428/jsp/opinion/story_12388910.jsp|title=A Matter of Honour|date=28 April 2010|publisher=The Telegraph|accessdate=4 April 2010|location=Calcutta, India}}</ref> and the first capital punishment verdict in an honour killing case in India.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.economist.com/node/15912850|title=A disgrace to the village|date=15 April 2010|publisher=[[The Economist]]|accessdate=20 May 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/05/24/AR2010052404075.html|title=5 sentenced to death in honor killing of Indian couple from same clan|date=25 May 2010|publisher=[[The Washington Post]]|accessdate=7 June 2010|first=Rama|last=Lakshmi}}</ref> The [[Indian media]] and legal experts hailed it as a "landmark judgement", a victory over these infamous assemblies, which acted for years with impunity as parallel judicial bodies. Also, few honour killing cases went to court, and this was the first case in which the groom's family in an honour killing filed the case.<ref name=the_australian/><ref name=abc/><ref name=thehindu/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.smh.com.au/breaking-news-world/indian-honour-killing-men-face-death-20100331-rcqo.html|title= Indian 'honour killing' men face death |date=31 March 2010|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|publisher=[[Fairfax Media]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> In a statement to the press, former Home Minister Chidambaram slammed the ''khap panchayats'', asking tersely, "Who are these khap panchayats? Who gave them the right to kill in the name of honour?"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesnow.tv/Home-Minister-slams-kangaroo-courts/articleshow/4341626.cms|title=Home Minister slams kangaroo courts |date=28 March 2010|publisher=[[Times Now]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref>
Surat Singh, director of the Haryana Institute of Rural Development, [[Nilokheri]], anticipated that the verdict will end the diktats of ''khap panchayats''. The ''khaps'' had never worried before because their "political bosses refrained people from acting against them. With this verdict, those who try to impose a medieval order on society will think twice".<ref name=indiatoday/> Political analyst Ranbir Singh agreed that the judgement will "act as a deterrent".<ref name=indiatoday/> Additional [[Advocate General#India|Advocate General]] Arun Walia hailed the decision: "before passing ruthless judgments, the members will surely take note of this decision".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailypioneer.com/245899/Verdict-a-deterrent-for-%E2%80%98Taliban-style-courts%E2%80%99.html |title=Verdict a deterrent for 'Taliban-style courts' |date=31 March 2010 |publisher=[[The Pioneer (Indian newspaper)|The Pioneer]] |accessdate=16 September 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110616065909/http://www.dailypioneer.com/245899/Verdict-a-deterrent-for-%E2%80%98Taliban-style-courts%E2%80%99.html |archivedate=16 June 2011 }}</ref>
The honour killing inspired Ajay Sinha to produce a film titled ''Khap—A Story of Honour Killing'' starring [[Om Puri]], [[Yuvika Chaudhary]], [[Govind Namdeo]], [[Anuradha Patel]], and [[Mohnish Behl]], to raise awareness about the ''khap''{{'}}s diktats.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/-Khap-should-be-made-tax-free-/675946/|title='Khap should be made tax-free'|date=3 September 2010|publisher=[[The Indian Express]]|accessdate=9 September 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-06-05/news-interviews/28305674_1_khap-babli-film|title=Ajai Sinha all set for 'Khap'|last=Shah|first=Kunal M.|date=5 June 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=[[The Times Group]]|accessdate=9 September 2010}}</ref> It will cost ₨25–30 million and was expected to enter theatres by late July 2010.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/entertainment/ajay-sinha-to-bring-honour-killing-issue-on-celluloid_100375633.html|title=Ajay Sinha to bring honour killing issue on celluloid|last=Bhirani|first=Radhika|date=5 June 2010|work=[[Indo-Asian News Service]]|publisher=Thaindian News|accessdate=9 September 2010}}</ref> Sinha claimed that the film is based on not one distinct killing but many. He considered the film "a protest against such traditions and practice".<ref name=outlook2>{{cite news|url=http://news.outlookindia.com/item.aspx?687544|title=Bollywood Lines Up Films Based on Honour Killings|last=Sharma|first=Raj Kumar|date=15 July 2010|publisher=[[Outlook (magazine)|Outlook]]|accessdate=9 September 2010}}</ref> For research, Sinha had visited Haryana and spoken to ''khap'' members.<ref name=outlook2/>
===Chanderpati=== Days after the verdict, a ''[[The Times of India]]'' headline hailed Chanderpati, who struggled years for justice, as "Mother Courage" for having done "what even top politicians and bureaucrats have shied away from doing—taken on the dreaded khap panchayats."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-01/india/28136711_1_khap-panchayat-karnal-sessions-court-chandrapati|title=Mother courage: She took on khaps to avenge son, bahu|last=Bhatia|first=Ramaninder K.|author2=Sukhbir Siwach|date=1 April 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=[[The Times Group]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> Chanderpati now lives with her two daughters and remaining son under the protection of two policemen. She withdrew her daughter Rekha from public school and sent Vinod to a school in another district.<ref name=joshi/> Chanderpati also reported threats from villagers, "The villagers have threatened to eliminate us. I am enemy number one and my son is a culprit. We've been told our ordeal can end if we withdraw the police case but we refused. So, the nightmare continues."<ref name=Gayatri2/>
Chanderpati has stated she intends to continue until Ganga Raj is sentenced to death:<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/2010/04/02/stories/2010040256640100.htm|title=Villages still in trauma after 'honour-killing' verdict|first=Vrinda|last= Sharma|date=2 April 2010|publisher=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=4 April 2010|location=Chennai, India}}</ref> "Our fight has not ended here. We will not rest till he [Ganga Raj] also gets the death penalty."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/uncategorized/honour-killing-grooms-family-wants-death-for-all-convicted_100341437.html|title=Honour killing: Groom's family wants death for all convicted|date=30 March 2010|work=IANS|publisher=Thaindian News|accessdate=7 June 2010}}</ref> The ''khap panchayats'' remain defiant even after the verdict.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-01/jaipur/28124693_1_khap-panchayats-sarpanch-jat-community|title=Caste panchayats vow to continue tradition|first=Anindo|last= Dey|date=1 April 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=[[The Times Group]]|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-02/india/28145012_1_manoj-and-babli-gotra-khaps|title=Mother invites ire of other khaps|date=2 April 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=The Times Group|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> "The verdict has done justice to my son's death, but it has not changed the way the village works," Chanderpati said.<ref name=thehindu3>{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/2010/04/02/stories/2010040256640100.htm|title=Villages still in trauma after 'honour-killing' verdict|first=Vrinda|last=Sharma|date=2 April 2010|publisher=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=4 April 2010|location=Chennai, India|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100406193219/http://www.thehindu.com/2010/04/02/stories/2010040256640100.htm <!--Added by H3llBot-->|archivedate=6 April 2010}}</ref> "I am fighting but my son died only because the girl's male relatives could kill their own sister. Families allow themselves to be instigated. As long as men can kill their own daughters, what change will there be?"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-04/all-that-matters/28127911_1_police-protection-manoj-village|title='What real change, if men still kill their daughters?'|first=Nandita|last=Sengupta|date=4 April 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=The Times Group|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref>
===Vani Gopal Sharma=== Judge Vani Gopal Sharma has supposedly been receiving threats since her verdict in the case.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100416/haryana.htm#1|title=Vani Gopal Sharma seeks transfer; fears for her life after honour killing verdict|work=Tribune Company|publisher=The Tribune|date=15 April 2010|accessdate=20 May 2010}}</ref> The High Court had directed adequate security to be provided to her, but later she again informed the High Court of the failure to increase security. She sought transfer to [[Panchkula]], a city near Chandigarh.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-17/india/28118932_1_honour-killings-vani-gopal-sharma-khap|title=Facing khap ire, Haryana judge seeks transfer|date=17 April 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=The Times Group|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> She requested this shortly after her verdict was denounced vehemently by the ''khap panchayats''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailypioneer.com/249531/Karnal-judge-seeks-transfer-%E2%80%98for-safety%E2%80%99.html |title=Karnal judge seeks transfer 'for safety' |date=16 April 2010 |work=The Pioneer |publisher=CMYK Printech Ltd. |accessdate=20 May 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110616070200/http://www.dailypioneer.com/249531/Karnal-judge-seeks-transfer-%E2%80%98for-safety%E2%80%99.html |archivedate=16 June 2011 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report_judge-who-awarded-death-to-honour-killers-seeks-transfer_1372314|title=Judge who awarded death to honour killers seeks transfer|date=17 April 2010|first=Ajay|last=Bharadwaj|work=DNA India|publisher=Diligent Media Corporation Ltd.|accessdate=20 May 2010}}</ref> The police chief of Karnal district, Rakesh Kumar Arya, claimed that Sharma did not complain about inadequate security.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100407/main4.htm|title=SP, DC in dock over security to judge|first=Saurabh|last=Malik|author2=Manish Sirhindi|work=Tribune Company|publisher=The Tribune|date=6 April 2010|accessdate=20 May 2010}}</ref> "There is no truth in reports that Karnal's Additional District Sessions Judge wants to move out of the district on account of inadequate security," he said. "I don't know whether any such request was made, but it looks unlikely."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesnow.tv/Threatened-Karnal-judge-requests-for-transfer/articleshow/4343252.cms|title=Threatened Karnal judge requests for transfer|publisher=Times Now|date=18 April 2010|accessdate=20 May 2010}}</ref>
===''Khap'' protests=== A ''maha khap panchayat'' (grand caste council)<ref name=khabrein>{{cite news|url=http://www.khabrein.info/news/Divisions_among_Khap_leaders__another_meeting_called_May_23_1271168464/|title=Divisions among Khap leaders, another meeting called May 23|work=khabrein.info|date=13 April 2010|accessdate=14 June 2010}}</ref> representing 20{{#tag:ref|There were different reports of the number of ''khap panchayats'' comprising the ''maha khap panchayat''. Some sources reported 20,<ref name=khabrein/><ref name=BBC2/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-13/india/28149783_1_gotra-marriages-khap-panchayats-khap-leaders|title=Will Khap defy the constitution?|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=The Times Group|date=13 April 2010|accessdate=14 June 2010}}</ref> while others recorded 36,<ref name=globalpost/><ref name=indianexpress/> and one even said 200.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ndtv.com/news/india/khap-panchayats-meet-in-haryana-remain-defiant-19905.php|title=Khap panchayats meet in Haryana, remain defiant|first=Vikram|last=Chowdhary |date=13 April 2010|publisher=NDTV|accessdate=14 June 2010}}</ref>|group=note}} ''khap panchayats'' of Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, and Rajasthan held a meeting on 13 April 2010, in [[Kurukshetra]] to challenge the court verdict and support those sentenced to death in the case.<ref name=thehindu2>{{cite news|url=http://beta.thehindu.com/opinion/lead/article424506.ece|title=Khap panchayat: signs of desperation?|first=Jagmati|last=Sangwan|publisher=The Hindu|date=7 May 2010|accessdate=14 June 2010|location=Chennai, India}}</ref><ref name=BBC2>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8617576.stm|title=India caste councils back men over 'honour killings'|work=[[BBC News]]|date=13 April 2010|accessdate=14 June 2010}}</ref><ref name=globalpost>{{cite news|url=http://www.globalpost.com/print/5548234|title=India: Incest, or star-crossed love? A north Indian caste wants laws changed to match honor-killing codes|first=Jason|last=Overdorf|work=[[GlobalPost]]|date=5 May 2010|accessdate=14 June 2010}}</ref> They planned to raise money for the families of the convicts to hire top lawyers for the appeal.<ref name=globalpost/> Each family in Haryana that was part of a ''khap panchayat'' was to contribute ₨10.<ref name=globalpost/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report_khaps-collect-money-for-honour-killers-kin_1370284|title=Khaps collect money for honour killers' kin|work=DNA India|publisher=Diligent Media Corporation Ltd.|date=12 April 2010|accessdate=14 June 2010}}</ref> They also demanded that the [[Hindu Marriage Act]] be amended to ban same-gotra marriages.<ref name=thehindu2/>
The ''khaps'' threatened to boycott any [[Member of Parliament|MP]] and assembly member from Haryana who did not back the ''khaps'' request.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/khap-panchayats-threatens-mps-delhi-blockade/116033-3.html|title=Khap panchayats threaten MPs, Delhi blockade|publisher=[[CNN-IBN]]|date=24 May 2010|accessdate=14 June 2010}}</ref> They also blocked the Kurukshetra-Kaithal highway in protest.<ref name=khabrein/><ref name=indianexpress>{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/amend-hindu-marriage-act-demand-khaps/606139/0|title=Amend Hindu Marriage Act, demand Khaps|work=[[The Indian Express]]|date=14 April 2010|accessdate=14 June 2010}}</ref>
Dissatisfied with the decision at the April meeting, the ''maha khap panchayat'' called another meeting on 23 May in [[Jind]] to discuss their plans.<ref name=khabrein/>
===Developments in honour killing law=== {{Quote box|align=right|width=27em|border=1px|bgcolor=#c6dbf7|quoted=true|quote=The vilest crimes are committed in the name of defending the honour of the family or women and we should hang our heads in shame when such incidents take place in India in the 21st century.|salign=right|source=—[[P. Chidambaram]], in response to a calling attention notice in the [[Rajya Sabha]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/uncategorized/honour-killings-a-shame-on-india-chidambaram_100224214.html|title=Honour killings a shame on India: Chidambaram |date=28 July 2009|work=[[Indo-Asian News Service]]|publisher=Thaindian News|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref>}} After the court judgement, state authorities began to take on the ''khap panchayats'', and consequently, many village [[sarpanch]]es (village heads) supporting these councils were suspended.<ref name=TOI2/> Top Jat leader and former minister [[Randeep Surjewala|Shamsher Singh Surjewala]] said, "The diktats and fatwas issued by so-called gotra khaps on breaking of marriages and other similar issues would lead to 'Talibanisation' of society as such decisions were illegal and against the constitution."<ref name=diktat/><ref name=TOI2>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-03-30/chandigarh/28132980_1_khap-panchayats-khap-leaders-illegal-bodies|title=Law tightens noose around khaps|first=Sukhbir|last= Siwach|date=30 March 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=The Times Group|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref>
On 5 August 2010, in a [[Parliament of India|Parliament]] session, Chidambaram proposed a bill that included "public stripping of women and externment of young couples from villages and any 'act which is humiliating will be punished with severity{{'"}} in the definition of honour killing<ref name=Faraz/> and that would "make khap-dictated honour killings a distinct offence so that all those who participate in the decision are liable to attract the death sentence".<ref name=TOI/> He insinuated that the proposed law would place the "onus of proof on the accused".<ref name=Faraz>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100806/nation.htm#1|title=Law on honour killings soon: PC|last=Ahmad|first=Faraz|work=Tribune Company|publisher=The Tribune|date=5 August 2010|accessdate=16 September 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-08-24/india/28311582_1_honour-killings-karnal-court-khap-leader|title=Haryana against honour killing law|first=Sukhbir|last= Siwach|date=24 August 2010|work=[[The Times of India]]|publisher=The Times Group|accessdate=4 April 2010}}</ref> A July 2010 ''[[The Times of India]]'' article anticipated that the bill would not pass in the monsoon session of Parliament in the same year.<ref name=TOI/> {{clear}}
==Appeal== The accused appealed to the Punjab and Haryana High Court. Ganga Raj's appeal for parole was declined. On 13 May 2010, the court admitted the appeal of him and the other six convicts challenging the court's verdict.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/Honour-killing--HC-admits-appeal-against-guilty-verdict/618514|title=Honour killing: HC admits appeal against guilty verdict|date=14 May 2010|publisher=[[The Indian Express]]|accessdate=20 May 2010|location=Chandigarh}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.outlookindia.com/item.aspx?681978|title=HC Admits Appeal of 7 Convicts in Double Murder Case|date=13 May 2010 |publisher=Outlook|accessdate=20 May 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2010/20100514/haryana.htm#5|title=Honour killing: Convicts' appeal admitted|work=Tribune Company|publisher=The Tribune|date=13 May 2010|accessdate=20 May 2010}}</ref> On 11 March, the Punjab and Haryana High Court commuted the death sentence awarded to four convicts – Babli's brother Suresh, uncles Rajender and Baru Ram and Gurdev in the Manoj–Babli honour killing case to life imprisonment. Ganga Raj, said to be the prime conspirator, and another convict Satish were acquitted.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/tp-newdelhi/article1530800.ece|title=Death sentence commuted in Manoj-Babli case|date=12 March 2011|publisher=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=21 March 2011|location=New Delhi}}</ref> In an interview to [[Newsclick]], Manoj's relatives – Seema and Chanderpati affirmed that they would challenge Ganga Raj's and Satish's acquittal in the [[Supreme court|Supreme Court]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://newsclick.in/india/dashing-hopes-emboldening-khaps-high-court-verdict-manoj-babli-case|title=Dashing hopes, Emboldening khaps – The High Court verdict on the Manoj Babli case|date=18 March 2011|publisher=Newsclick|accessdate=21 March 2011|location=New Delhi}}</ref>
==In popular culture== The June 3, 2012, episode, ''[[Satyamev Jayate (Season 1)#Episode 5: Intolerance to Love|Intolerance to Love]]'' of TV series, ''[[Satyamev Jayate (TV show)|Satyamev Jayate]]'', hosted by actor [[Aamir Khan]], featured an interview with Manoj’s sister Seema and mother and Chandrapati Banwala. The episode discussed this incident along with other cases in the episode.<ref>{{cite web| title = Review: Satyamev Jayate Ep 5 touches draconian tradition of honour killings|publisher=DNA India| url = http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/1697729/review-review-satyamev-jayate-ep-5-touches-draconian-tradition-of-honour-killings|date= Jun 4, 2012| accessdate = 2013-08-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web| title = Satyamev Jayate speaks up for lovers!| url =http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-06-04/tv/32030254_1_aamir-khap-panchayat-love-marriage|date=Jun 4, 2012| accessdate = 2013-08-17| publisher = The Times of India}}</ref>
In August 2013, senior journalist Chander Suta Dogra, published a book, ''Manoj and Babli: A Hate Story'' (Penguin) based on the honour killing case.<ref>{{cite web| title = Skeletons in the closet|publisher=Hindustan Times| url = http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/DontMiss/Skeletons-in-the-closet/Article1-1102640.aspx|date=August 3, 2013| accessdate = 2013-08-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web| title = Honour Bound|publisher=Indian Express| url =http://www.indianexpress.com/news/honour-bound/1151496/|date= Aug 6, 2013| accessdate = 2013-08-17 }}</ref>
In 2015, a Bollywood Hindi film ''[[Guddu Rangeela]]'' used Manoj–Babli honour killing case in its storyline.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/guddu-rangeela-inspired-by-manoj-babli-honour-killing-case/|title=‘Guddu Rangeela’ inspired by Manoj-Babli honour killing case}}</ref> Also in 2015, the Bollywood film ''[[NH10 (film)|NH10]]'' was released to critical and public acclaim with a story-line loosely based on this case.

{{EngvarB|date=November 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Refimprove|date=January 2010}} {{Infobox person | name = Mukesh | image = Mukesh 2016 stamp of India.jpg | birth_name = Mukesh Chand Mathur | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1923|7|22}} | birth_place = [[Delhi]], [[British Raj|British India]]
(now in [[India]]) | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1976|8|27|1923|7|22}} | death_place = [[Detroit, Michigan|Detroit]], [[Michigan]], [[U.S.]] | nationality = Indian | occupation = [[Playback singer]] | years_active = 1940–1976 | spouse = {{marriage|Sarla Trivedi Raichand|1946}} | other_names = Voice of the Millennium, Tragedy King | children = 5, including [[Nitin Mukesh]] | relatives = [[Neil Nitin Mukesh]] (grandson) | awards = {{plainlist| * 1 [[National Film Awards]] * 3 [[Bengal Film Journalists' Association Awards]] * 4 [[Filmfare Award for Best Male Playback Singer]] }} | signature = Mukesh Signature.svg }} '''Mukesh Chand Mathur''' (22 July 1923 – 27 August 1976), better known [[Mononymous person|mononymously]] as '''Mukesh''', was an Indian playback singer. Mukesh is considered to be one of the most popular and acclaimed playback singers of the [[Hindi film industry]].{{cite book |title= Global Bollywood: Travels of Hindi Song and Dance |last= Gopal |first= Sangita |author2=Sujata Moorti |year= 2008 |publisher= University of Minnesota Press|isbn= 0-8166-4579-5 |page= 94}}''Encyclopedia of Indian Cinema'' by Ashish Rajadhyaksha and Paul Willemen. Oxford University Press, 1994. {{ISBN|0-85170-455-7}}, page 169.{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/doodles/mukeshs-93rd-birthday|title=Mukesh's 93rd Birthday|website=www.google.com|language=en|access-date=27 January 2018}} Amongst the numerous nominations and awards he won, his song "Kai Baar Yuhi Dekha Hai" from the film ''[[Rajnigandha]]'' (1973) won him the [[National Film Award for Best Male Playback Singer]]. Mukesh was also popular as being the voice of actors [[Raj Kapoor]], [[Manoj Kumar]], [[Feroz Khan (actor)|Feroz Khan]], [[Sunil Dutt]] and [[Dilip Kumar]].{{cite web|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/mukesh-remembering-the-singer-with-the-midas-touch/story-kTGymf56kD6so2K4tL0dDO.html|title=Mukesh: Remembering the singer with the midas touch |author=Rohit Vats|website=[[Hindustan Times]]|date=27 August 2014|accessdate=9 May 2018}} ==Early life== Mukesh was born in [[Delhi]] in [[Hindu]] [[Kayastha]] family.{{cite book|author=Abdul Jamil Khan |title=Urdu/Hindi: An Artificial Divide: African Heritage, Mesopotamian Roots, Indian Culture & Britiah Colonialism |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=nH1HBxdA1UIC&pg=PA316 |year=2006 |publisher=Algora Publishing |isbn=978-0-87586-438-9 |pages=316–}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sIsBeVv1qDE&t=884|title=Exclusive : Neil Nitin Mukesh & Nitin Mukesh In Conversation With Karan Thapar|date=23 October 2016}} His parents were Zorawar Chand Mathur, an engineer, and Chandrani Mathur. He was the sixth in a family of ten children. The music teacher who came home to teach Mukesh's sister, Sundar Pyari, found a pupil in Mukesh, who would listen from the adjoining room. Mukesh left school after the 10th grade and worked briefly for the Department of [[Public Works]]. He experimented with voice recordings during his employment in Delhi and gradually developed his singing abilities and also his musical instrumental skills. ==Singing career== Mukesh's voice was first noticed by [[Motilal Rajvansh|Motilal]], a distant relative, when he sang at his sister's wedding. Motilal took him to [[Mumbai]] and arranged for singing lessons by Pandit Jagannath Prasad. During this period Mukesh was offered a role as an actor-singer in a Hindi film, ''Nirdosh'' (1941). His first song was "Dil Hi Bujha Hua Ho To" as an actor-singer for ''Nirdosh''. He got his break as a playback singer for actor Motilal in 1945 with the film ''Pehli Nazar'' with music composed by [[Anil Biswas (composer)|Anil Biswas]] and lyrics written by Aah Sitapuri. The first song that he sang for a Hindi film was "Dil Jalta Hai To Jalne De". Mukesh was such a fan of singer [[K. L. Saigal]] that in his early years of playback singing he used to imitate his idol.{{Cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/mukesh-remembering-the-singer-with-the-midas-touch/story-kTGymf56kD6so2K4tL0dDO.html|title=Mukesh: Remembering the singer with the midas touch|last=Vats|first=Rohit|date=27 August 2014|work=Hindustan Times|access-date=17 March 2016|via=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.iloveindia.com/indian-heroes/mukesh.html|title=Famous Indians – Mukesh|last=|first=|date=|website=iloveindia.com|publisher=|access-date=17 March 2016}} In fact, it is said that when K. L. Saigal first heard the song "Dil Jalta Hai...", he remarked, "That's strange, I don't recall singing that song". Mukesh created his own singing style with the help of music director [[Naushad Ali]], who helped Mukesh to come out of his Saigal style and create his own style. Naushad gave him songs for the film ''[[Andaz (1949 film)|Andaz]]''. Initially Mukesh was the ghost voice of [[Dilip Kumar]] in this movie and [[Mohammed Rafi]] sang for [[Raj Kapoor]]. He delivered many Hits for Naushad in films like: ''Anokhi Ada'' (1948), ''[[Mela (1948 film)|Mela]]'' (1948), ''[[Andaz (1949 film)|Andaz]]'' (1949). Other composers who used Mukesh voice for great Dilip Kumar in hit songs like "Jeevan Sapna toot gaya" were Anil Biswas in Anokha Pyar, Ye Mera Diwanapan hai, Shankar-Jaikishan in Yahudi and Suhana Safar and Dil Tadap Tadap ke, Salil Choudhary in Madhumati. However, later Dilip Kumar choose [[Mohammed Rafi|Rafi]] as his ghost voice and Mukesh became the ghost voice of Raj Kapoor. Mukesh recorded highest number of songs for Shankar Jaikishan ie 133 songs followed by kalyanji Anandji ie 99 songs. Out of 4 Filmfare awards, Mukesh won 3 awards for Shankar Jaikishan songs In 1974, Mukesh received [[National Film Award for Best Male Playback Singer]] for the song "Kai Baar Yuhi Dekha Hai" from ''[[Rajnigandha]]'' (1974), and [[Filmfare Award]]s for the songs "Sab Kuch Seekha Humne" in the movie ''Anari'' (1959), "Sabse Bada Naadan Wahi Hai" in ''Pehchaan'' (1970), "Jai Bolo Beimaan Ki" in ''Beimaan'' (1972) (all the three songs composed by Shankar Jaikishan) and "[[Kabhi Kabhie Mere Dil Mein]]", the title song of film ''[[Kabhie Kabhie (1976 film)|Kabhie Kabhie]]'' (1976) (composed by Khayyam). A total of around 1,300 songs were sung by him. This number is less than those sung by some of his contemporaries, but the fact is that Mukesh emphasised on quality rather than quantity. The comparatively fewer songs sung by him in the 1970s can be attributed to his failing health due to his worsening heart problem. Mukesh sang many songs for Kalyanji Anandji music director duo. Mukesh sang more songs with the K-A duo after Shankar Jaikishan. From "Naina hai jadoo bhare..." ''Bedard Zamana Kya Jane'' (1958) composed by Kalyanji alone as Kalyanji Virji Shah, and "Main hoon mast madari..." ''[[Madari]]'' (1959) as the first Kalyanji-Anandji-Mukesh combo, to "Chahe aaj mujhe napasand karo" ''[[Darinda/ 1977]]'', the K-A, Mukesh combination gave numerous popular songs like "Chhalia mera naam...", "Mere toote hue dil se...", "Dum dum diga diga" ''[[Chalia]]''(1959), "Mujhko iss raat ki tanhai mein..." ''[[Dil Bhi Tera Hum Bhi Tere]]'' (1960), "Hum chhod chale hain mehfil ko..." (Ji Chahta Hai), "Humne tumko pyar kiya hai jitna..." (Dulha Dulhan), "Chal mere dil lehraake chal..." ''[[Ishara]]'' and "Dheere se chalo..." ''[[Johar Mehmood in Goa]]'',"Main to ek khwab hoon..." and "Chand si mehbooba ho..." ''[[Himalay Ki Godmein]]''(1965), "Waqt kartaa jo wafaa..." ''[[Dil Ne Pukara]]'',"Deewanon se yeh mat poocho..." ''[[Upkar]]'', "Khush raho har khushi hai..." ''[[Suhaag Raat]]'' and "Humsafar ab yeh safar kat jaayega..." ''[[Juari]]'', "Chandi ki deewaar..." and "Le chal le chal mere jeevan saathi..." ''[[Vishwas]]'' (1969), "Koi jab tumhara hriday tod de..." ''[[Purab Aur Paschim]]'', "Darpan ko dekha..." ''[[Upaasna]]'', "Jo tumko ho pasand..." ''[[Safar]]'' and "Mujhe nahin poochni tumse beeti baatein..." ''[[Anjaan Raahein]]'' (1970). Out of the numerous songs he gave his voice to, "Kahin door jab din dhal Jaaye" from ''[[Anand (1971 film)|Anand]]''(1971),{{youtube|wTqcXXRANkw|Kahin Door Jab Din Dhal Jaaye – Mukesh – Anand 1970 HD}} "Ek Pyaar ka Nagma hai" from ''[[Shor (film)|Shor]]'' (1972), "Maine Tere Liye Hi Saat Rang Ke" from [[Anand (1970 film)|''Anand'']] (1972), "Sab Kuch Seekha Humne" from ''[[Anari]]'' (1959), "Jeena yahan marna yahan" and "Kehta hai Joker" from ''[[Mera Naam Joker]]'' (1971) are the most popular among his fans and followers.{{cite web|url=http://www.moviemadaari.in/2016/07/mukesh-ki-kahaani-unsung-singing-legend-hindi-cinema/|title=Mukesh Ki Kahaani-Story of the most unsung singing legend of Hindi Cinema|last=Ganguly|first=Souvik|date=22 July 2016|website=Movie Madaari|publisher=|access-date=| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161002011919/http://www.moviemadaari.in/2016/07/mukesh-ki-kahaani-unsung-singing-legend-hindi-cinema/| archivedate=2 October 2016 |deadurl=yes}} ==As an actor and producer== Mukesh started his career as an actor singer in the film ''Nirdosh'' in 1941, with Nalini Jaywant as his heroine. His second film was ''Adab Arz'' in 1943. He played a guest role in Raj Kapoor's film ''Aah'' in 1953. He acted as a hero in the film ''Mashooka'' in 1953, opposite Suraiya and in the film ''Anurag'' (1956) (he was also the co-producer and composer in the film), opposite [[Usha Kiran]] and ''Mridula Rani''. Mukesh also produced a film ''Malhar'' (1951) with hero Arjun & heroine Shammi with Darling Films.[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0006715/bio Mukesh]. IMDb[https://web.archive.org/web/20030119104929/http://www.singermukesh.com/reellife.htm Movies Of Mukesh]. singermukesh.com[http://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/blast-from-the-past-malhar-1951/article3257837.ece Blast from the past: Malhar (1951)]. The Hindu (29 March 2012). Retrieved on 2018-11-06. == Appreciation == Mukesh was a favourite of renowned Indian spin-bowler [[Bhagwath Chandrasekhar]]. When the sound of a Mukesh song drifted to the pitch, Chandrasekhar's acknowledgement of the tribute would bring a roar from the crowd. [[Sunil Gavaskar]] wrote that sometimes he hummed a Mukesh tune on the field to inspire Chandra. Chandra's passion affected team-mates [[Syed Kirmani|Kirmani]], [[Gundappa Viswanath]], and even some journalists.{{cite web | url=http://www.thecricketmonthly.com/story/1125092/coffee-with-chandra | title=Coffee with Chandra | publisher=[[ESPN Cricinfo]] | work=The Cricket Monthly | date=6 November 2017 | accessdate=7 November 2017 | author=Menon, Suresh| authorlink = Suresh Menon (sports writer)}} Google commemorated Mukesh on his 93rd birthday anniversary in 2016. ==Personal life== Mukesh married Sarla Trivedi Raichand, daughter of Raichand Trivedi. Sarla's father was a millionaire. With no proper house, an erratic income and what was then considered in India a supposedly "immoral" profession (singer in movies), the consent of Sarla's father for this marriage could not be obtained and Mukesh and Sarla were forced to elope. They got married in a temple in [[Kandivali]] on 22 July 1946, Mukesh's 23rd birthday, with the help of the actor [[Motilal Rajvansh|Motilal]] and from the residence of R. D. Mathur. Everyone made dire predictions of unhappy days and divorce, but both weathered the lean days and celebrated their thirtieth wedding anniversary on 22 July 1976, four days before his departure for the USA. The couple had five children – Rita, the singer [[Nitin Mukesh|Nitin]], Nalini (d. 1978), Mohnish and Namrata (Amrita). The actor [[Neil Nitin Mukesh]] is a grandson of Mukesh (son of Nitin).{{cn|date=September 2016}} ==Death== Mukesh died of a heart attack on 27 August 1976 in [[Detroit, Michigan]], US, where he had gone to perform in a concert. That morning, he got up early and went to take a shower. He came out panting and complaining of chest pains. He was rushed to a hospital but was pronounced dead. The rest of the concert was completed by [[Lata Mangeshkar]] and surprisingly his son [[Nitin Mukesh]] . His body was flown to India by [[Lata Mangeshkar]], where a grand funeral ceremony was held in the presence of several actors, with personalities of the [[Indian film industry]] and fans paying tribute. When news of his death reached [[Raj Kapoor]], he burst into tears, and remarked, "I have lost my voice,"{{citation needed|date=February 2012}} which is a testimony to the association of Mukesh's voice (in playback) to the immensely popular songs of Raj Kapoor's films. A famous song of the 50's featured on Bharat Bhushan ''Aa laut ke aa ja mere meet'' is another example of his earlier melodies, as is ''Dil tadap tadapke keh raha hai'', picturised on Dilip Kumar. After Mukesh's death, his newer, hitherto unreleased, songs were released in 1977 in films such as ''[[Dharam Veer (1977 film)|Dharam Veer]]'', ''[[Amar Akbar Anthony]]'', ''Khel khiladi ka'', ''Darinda'' and ''Chandi sona''. The year 1978 also featured a considerable number of Mukesh's songs in films such as ''Aahuti'', ''Paramatma'', ''Tumhari kasam'' and ''Satyam Shivam Sundaram'', where Mukesh sang his last film song ''Chanchal sheetal nirmal komal'' for [[Raj Kapoor]]'s younger brother, [[Shashi Kapoor]]. From 1980 onward, Mukesh's voice was heard in many later released films such as ''Shaitan mujarim'', ''Premika'', ''Patthar se takkar'' (1980), ''Sanjh ki bela'', ''Maila anchal'' (1981), ''Aarohi'' (1982), ''Chor mandali'' (1983), ''Nirlaj'' (1985), ''Love and God'' (1986), ''Shubh chintak'' (1989), and his last known release of ''Chand grahan'' (1997). ==Awards== [[File:Mukesh 2016 postcard of India.jpg|thumb|Mukesh on a 2016 postcard from the series Legendary Singers of India]] ===National Film Awards=== * 1974 – [[National Film Award for Best Male Playback Singer]] for the song "Kai Baar Yuhi Dekha Hai" from the film ''[[Rajnigandha]]'' ===Filmfare Awards=== ====Won==== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
